intro: Caruelina hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy caruelina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Caruelina hirsuta is often found in grasslands and open habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
